###The Strategy 

We can find the image of a transformation using the following steps. 

- Find the coordinates of its vertices, and arrange them as a matrix with the $x$-values in the top row and the $y$-values in the bottom row. 

- Multiply the coordinate matrix by the transformation matrix. The resulting matrix will give the coordinates of the new vertices, also with the $x$-values in the top row and the $y$-values in the bottom row.  

- Plot the result.

###Finding the coordinate matrix 

The original triangle has vertices at $(2,2)$, $(4,6)$, and $(6,2)$. Arranging this as a matrix, we get the matrix $M$, below. 

$M=\left[\begin{array} {ccc}
2 & 4 & 6 \\
2 & 6 & 2 \end{array} \right]$

###Transforming the coordinate matrix 

To transform the triangle, we multiply $M$ by $R$ to get a new coordinate matrix. 

$\begin{align}RM&=\left[\begin{array} {ccc}
0 & -1.5 \\
1.5 & 0  \end{array} \right]\left[\begin{array} {ccc}
2 & 4 & 6 \\
2 & 6 & 2 \end{array} \right]
\\\\&=\left[\begin{array} {ccc}
-3 & -9 & -3 \\
3 & 6 & 9 \end{array} \right]\end{align}$ 

Therefore, the transformed triangle has the vertices $(-3,3)$, $(-9,6)$, and $(-3,9)$.

###Summary
